feed.title: NewsTracker: facebook
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Christie-Paul debate exchange top Facebook social moment
entry.summary:
The social moment of the debate on Facebook proved to be the heated exchange between Chris Christie and Rand Paul over government privacy policy.

New data from Facebook showed that while immigration was the top issue discussed and real estate mogul Donald Trump was the candidate most discussed, the give and take over how far the government should go in collecting data was the big social moment.

entry.title: Thai military courts harshly punish 2 for Facebook comments
entry.summary:
Thailand's military courts have issued the harshest sentences in recent decades for two people convicted of insulting the monarchy on Facebook.

The hotel worker in the northern province of Chiang Mai was also found guilty of posting offensive Facebook comments, but had her cumulative sentence halved to 28 years after pleading guilty.

entry.title: Facebook's new live video streaming - how it stacks up
entry.summary: Facebook has joined the live-stream-video scene - but so far, it's only for famous people.

entry.title: Facebook launches live video for celebs
Facebook lets businesses message users privately
entry.summary:
If users post a comment on a business's Facebook page, then the business can now privately message that person.

Facebook Inc rolled out features Wednesday that enable businesses to privately communicate with customers through messages as part of the social networking company's push to make its Messenger app a stand-alone platform.

Businesses can now include a "send message" button in ads that appear in Newsfeed that allow Facebook users to click a button and send messages, which are private.

The features are part of Facebook's efforts to convince more small and medium-sized businesses - especially those in emerging markets, such as India, Brazil and Indonesia - to advertise on its platform.

About twice as many Thai and Singaporean users use Facebook messages to communicate with businesses each month and most Southeast Asia users follow some company pages.

entry.title: Facebook's famously private founder opens up about deeply personal subject
entry.summary:
It was a rare and deeply personal revelation, not just for the famously private Zuckerberg but for anyone on Facebook.

His post immediately went viral, with commenters praising the Facebook executive for his candor.

"Mark Zuckerberg" became a trending topic on Twitter, and his post received about 850,000 Facebook likes within six hours of posting.

"It's following the philosophy of Facebook, and in doing so he's showing he's a human being like everyone else."

entry.title: Ex-Senate candidate: Board has ended probe of Facebook posts
entry.summary: Milton Wolf says the medical board has determined he committed no wrongdoing by posting the images on Facebook.

entry.title: Will Smith takes to Facebook to deny divorce
entry.summary: Will Smith takes to Facebook to deny divorce "Men in Black" star Will Smith took the unusual step on Monday of publicly shooting down a report that he and his actress wife of 17 years had decided to divorce.

entry.title: Will Smith denies divorce reports on Facebook
entry.summary: Smith, 46, said in statement on his Facebook page that "under normal circumstances, I don't usually respond to foolishness. (Because it's contagious).

entry.title: Donald Trump's campaign fires adviser after racially charged Facebook posts
entry.summary: WASHINGTON - Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump has fired a campaign aide after racially charged Facebook posts surfaced on the aide's account.

entry.title: Trump campaign fires staffer over controversial Facebook posts
entry.summary: Donald Trump's presidential campaign has fired a staffer after racially charged and insulting Facebook posts under his name came to light, a person close to the campaign said on Sunday.

entry.title: Trump campaign fires staffer over controversial Facebook posts
Donald Trump staffer fired over past racially charged Facebook posts
Mark Zuckerberg's Facebook Update: Expecting A Baby
entry.summary: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and his pediatrician wife, Priscilla Chan, are expecting a baby.

entry.title: Facebook's giant drone to beam internet to remote regions
entry.summary:
Separately, Facebook a year ago launched internet.org, an initiative to provide internet access to the two-thirds of the world that do not have a reliable connection.

Mr Parikh said Facebook is not planning to sell the drones but will use them to expand internet access.

entry.title: Facebook ready to test giant drone for Internet service
entry.summary: Facebook's drone was developed in part with engineering expertise that joined the company when it acquired a British aerospace startup, Ascenta, last year.

entry.title: Facebook ready to test giant drone for Internet service
entry.summary:
Facebook also has a separate but related initiative that works with wireless carriers to provide limited mobile Internet service at no cost, in countries where residents are too poor to afford traditional wireless plans.

Facebook hopes to share the technology with telecommunications carriers and development agencies, which it hopes will build and operate the drone networks, Parikh said.

entry.title: Facebook ready to test giant drone for internet service
entry.summary: Facebook has said it will begin test flights later this year of a solar-powered drone with the wingspan of a Boeing 737, the next stage of its campaign to deliver internet service to remote parts of the world.

entry.title: Facebook ready to test giant drone for Internet service
Facebook shares slide even as profit beats forecasts
entry.summary:
Facebook had 1.49 billion monthly users overall, up 13%.

"Once again Facebook has proven its ability to attract and retain users. It's particularly impressive that users are more engaged than ever before - that the percentage of monthly users who visit every day continues to grow," said Forrester Research analyst Nate Elliott.

Facebook's mobile advertising represented 76% of the total advertising revenue during the second quarter, proof that the company continues to attract advertisers to where its users are - on smartphones and other hand-held gadgets.

entry.title: Here Are The Key Things To Watch Out For In Facebook's Q2 Earnings
What to watch for in Facebookâ€™s Wednesday earnings report
Facebook to scale up free mobile Internet service to boost usage
entry.summary:
MUMBAI (Reuters) - Facebook Inc plans to scale up its service to offer free basic Internet on mobile phones, an executive said, after introducing the application in 17 developing countries over the past year.

In a blog post released to mark the first year of the initiative, Facebook said it will open a portal allowing any mobile operator to offer the service under its Internet.org platform.

Facebook currently partners with specific operators to launch the service in different countries.

It offers pared-down web services for free to users, along with access to Facebook's own social network and messaging services.

Facebook was not paying for any of the data being used to access the service, he said.

entry.title: Facebook defeats shareholder litigation over IPO
entry.summary:
Shareholders said Facebook should have publicly revealed its internal projections on how increased mobile usage might reduce future revenue, rather than quietly warn its underwriters, which then cut their earnings forecasts.

Sweet also oversees shareholder class-action litigation against Facebook itself over the IPO.

entry.title: Facebook defeats shareholder litigation over IPO
entry.summary:
In the case decided on Friday, shareholders alleged that Facebook should have disclosed its internal projections on how increased mobile usage might reduce future revenue.

Writing for the appeals court, however, Circuit Judge Dennis Jacobs said that because Facebook made its disclosures before going public, shareholders could not have contemporaneously owned its stock, and thus could not sue its directors and underwriters.

The case is In re: Facebook Inc Initial Public Offering Derivative Litigation, 2nd U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals, Nos.

entry.title: Facebook, Twitter, Google push back against terrorism-alert bill
entry.summary:
Monika Bickert, head of policy management at Facebook, said the social media site shares the government's goal of keeping terrorist content off the site.

"Our policies on this are crystal clear: We do not permit terrorist groups to use Facebook, and people are not allowed to promote or support these groups on Facebook," she said.

entry.title: Facebook loses in clash with prosecutors over users' data
entry.summary: Facebook said prosecutors cast too wide a net.

entry.title: Facebook loses in clash with prosecutors over users' data
Facebook loses in clash with prosecutors over warrants for users' data, weighing its options
entry.summary:
Facebook had lost earlier rulings and already turned the data over.

Facebook said it was weighing its options for continuing the fight.

entry.title: Facebook loses in clash with prosecutors over warrants for users' data, weighing its options
entry.summary:
"In many cases, evidence on their Facebook accounts directly contradicted the lies the defendants told to the Social Security Administration" about being too psychologically devastated to work, district attorney's office spokeswoman Joan Vollero said Tuesday.

The court said Facebook wrongly argued it could legally stop prosecutors from gathering the information, as opposed to defendants arguing for keeping it out of court afterward.

Facebook can contain more intimate personal information than someone's home, the judges noted, and only 62 of the people targeted in the 381 warrants have been charged.

Google, Twitter and other online players joined the case on Facebook's side, as did the American and New York civil liberties union.

entry.title: Chicago-area man accused of threatening Emanuel, others
entry.summary: He allegedly wrote on Facebook, "I'm not leaving America without getting revenge even if it costs me my life."

entry.title: Clinton on Facebook: 'Black lives matter' and other takeaways
Crying kid in diner ignites Facebook war between mom, owner
entry.summary:
Neugebauer wrote on Facebook that the girl had been crying for more than 40 minutes by the time she slammed her hands on the counter and told the girl to be quiet.

Tara Carson, the mother of the child, wrote on Facebook that anyone with young children should understand that crying is normal after waiting such a long time for food.

entry.title: Google shares soar as YouTube growth allays fears over Facebook
Google shares surge as YouTube growth eases Facebook video fears
entry.summary: YouTube has an edge over Facebook as it has a more mature monetization platform that seems to attract the best content, Piper Jaffray analyst Gene Munster said.

entry.title: Google Soars on 2Q Results, YouTube Growth
entry.summary: Google and Facebook are trying to woo big companies to market their products via online videos.

entry.title: Woman found dead in Texas jail had spoken about depression
entry.summary: Bland had posted a video to her Facebook page on March 1 in which she said that she was suffering from "a little bit of depression as well as PTSD," or post-traumatic stress disorder.

entry.title: Australian deported from Abu Dhabi after 'writing bad words' on Facebook
Aussie deported from Abu Dhabi
entry.summary: Jodi Magi, 39, was sentenced for a cyber crimes offence after reportedly posting a photo on Facebook of a car parked across two disabled spots outside her Abu Dhabi apartment.

entry.title: Facebook 'developing Siri rival Moneypenny'
Australian woman jailed in Abu Dhabi for Facebook post
entry.summary:
Jodi Magi, aged 39, posted a photo to Facebook she had taken of a car parked across two disabled parking spaces outside her apartment in Abu Dhabi.

The photo appeared to have been removed from Ms Magi's Facebook page, which has now also been taken offline.

entry.title: Australian woman jailed in Abu Dhabi for Facebook post
entry.summary: A Facebook page called Savvy Women Abu Dhabi said that Ms Magi had lived in Abu Dhabi since early 2012 and she is there to teach Emirate women art, illustration and graphic design.

entry.title: Facebook looking to add music videos
entry.summary:
Labels would be able to choose the videos in question, and Facebook share any resulting advertising revenue with them.

Music videos could help Facebook to grow its video views, and in turn steal more eyeballs from YouTube.

Facebook didn't immediately respond to a request for comment on its music video plans.

entry.title: Facebook Looking to Stream Music Videos
Facebook makes it easier to tweak what you see in your feed
entry.summary: This product image provided by Facebook shows the News Feed Preferences setting within the Facebook app for iPhone.

entry.title: Facebook Said to Seek Music Video Licensing Deals
entry.summary: "We have no plans to go into music streaming," a Facebook representative said.

entry.title: Facebook makes it easier to tweak what you see in your feed
entry.summary:
Facebook wants to give users more control to weed through the clutter of boring, unwanted information, often from long-forgotten acquaintances, on their news feed _ and see more of what they want to see.

NEW YORK (AP) - Facebook wants you to see more of what you want to see.

Facebook's computer software uses a wide range of information you provide to decide what to show.

entry.title: Facebook makes it easier to tweak what you see in your feed
entry.summary: For the rest, though, Facebook will continue to use its software to choose what to show you.
